column1: Kimiya Yui (?? ???, Yui Kimiya, born 1970) is a Japanese astronaut candidate from the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency.
Yui, from Nagano Prefecture, enrolled in the Japan Air Self-Defense Force after graduating from the National Defense Academy of Japan in 1992.
He has piloted a F-15 Eagle fighter, and currently works in the Air Staff Office's Defense Planning Division.
The NEEMO 16 crew successfully "splashed down" at 11:05 am on June 11.
On the morning of June 12, Yui and his crewmates officially became aquanauts, having spent over 24 hours underwater.

column2: The crew safely returned to the surface on June 22.
